creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: Mounted Cup with domed cover, cup decorated with double row of rectangular perforations, cover has incised line with dots, knob, two bands; gray stoneware, partially overed with brownish ash glaze.
text: The excavations of Anjap-ji, a pond within a 7th century palace compound, revealed much about the daily life and material goods of the Korean aristocracy during the Silla dynasty. High-fired stoneware in elegant, wheel-turned shapes, like this one, were commonly used as tableware.
title: (Lidded Bowl on High Foot)
